intro: Psila tenella, commonly known as the slender psila, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
